title: 'I Love Muhammad' row: What sparked violent protests in UP’s Bareilly? 10 things to know
content: Protests over "I Love Muhammad" posters turned violent in Uttar Pradesh. Bareilly witnessed stone-pelting and vehicle vandalism after Friday prayers. Police used lathi charge and tear gas to disperse crowds. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath ordered strict action against miscreants. Religious and political leaders appealed for calm. The unrest spread to several other states. Authorities ensured heightened security for upcoming festivals.

title: 'Wanted in several cases': 17 killed after Pakistani forces clash with TTP militants
content: Seventeen Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) militants were killed in a joint operation by security forces in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa's Karak district after they opened fire, injuring three personnel. A curfew was imposed for further operations. Separately, an airstrike reportedly killed 23 civilians, including women and children, in the same province, though no official statement has been issued.

title: Where does power lie in Pakistan? Khawaja Asif admits to 'Hybrid Model'
content: Pakistan's defence minister Khawaja Asif defended the nation's "hybrid model" of governance, asserting military and civilian leadership operate "by consensus." He dismissed claims of army dominance, attributing such perceptions to past military rulers, while controversially labeling US democracy a "deep state." Asif maintained this arrangement, though not ideal, is a "practical necessity" for managing Pakistan's crises, despite critics branding it undemocratic.

title: MP: 4-year-old hacked to death in front of mother; assailant dies after mob attack
content: A four-year-old boy was brutally killed in Indore's Aali village. A 24-year-old man attacked the child with a sharp weapon. The boy's mother was also injured while trying to intervene. Villagers confronted the assailant, who was then tied up and assaulted. Police took him to the hospital where he later died. A judicial probe has been ordered into his death.

title: Tech CEO slams H-1B fee hike; warns change only helps big firms
content: Box CEO Aaron Levie has strongly criticised President Trump's new $100,000 H-1B visa fee, warning it grants large tech companies an unfair advantage over cash-strapped startups in the global talent acquisition race. Levie argued the steep cost transforms international hiring into a 'spending game' smaller firms cannot win, potentially pushing innovation overseas. He advocated for a significantly lower $20,000 fee and a broader reform framework with flexible visa caps, aiming to attract top global talent while safeguarding American wages.

title: 'Proliferation of trade-restrictive actions': Brics declaration slams Trump tariffs
content: BRICS foreign ministers condemned Trump-era US tariffs as trade-restrictive actions disrupting global supply chains and economic stability. Meeting on the sidelines of UNGA80, the expanded group, including new members, also pushed for reforms in global institutions like the UN Security Council and greater representation for developing nations, underscoring their growing influence.

title: 'Paagal ho gaya hai kya?': Rinku Singh's hilarious dig at Arshdeep Singh goes viral
content: Indian cricketers Rinku Singh, Arshdeep Singh, and Jitesh Sharma shared a fun moment after India's Super Over win against Sri Lanka. Rinku playfully teased Arshdeep about his match-winning two wickets in the Super Over, recreating a viral reel. India, now clear favourites, will face Pakistan in the Asia Cup final.

title: ‘Forced to speak Hindi’: Kerala students assaulted near Red Fort
content: CPI(M) MP John Brittas has urged Delhi Police to investigate the alleged assault of two Kerala students near Red Fort. The students were reportedly beaten, stripped, and humiliated by police and locals after being falsely accused of theft. They were mocked for their traditional attire and limited Hindi, prompting Brittas to call for justice and cultural sensitivity from the force.

title: Accenture fired 11,000+ employees; CEO Julie Sweet warns, exit or upgrade
content: Accenture laid off over 11,000 employees globally in three months, citing rapid AI adoption and slowing corporate demand. These cuts are part of an $865 million restructuring, with more exits anticipated as the company aligns its workforce with AI-driven solutions and invests in agentic AI training. Despite the layoffs, Accenture reported a 7% revenue increase.

title: 30 years a slave: Abducted as 7-yr-old, Ahmedabad man returns to find home
content: A 7-year-old boy, kidnapped from Ahmedabad over three decades ago, reappeared at 35 after escaping bonded labor in Haryana. Forced to work on an animal farm, he clung to fragmented memories of his family. Now, police are assisting the man, identified as 'Raju', in his challenging quest to reunite with his long-lost relatives.

title: J&K: BSF IG says 'there is presence of terrorists on LoC launch pads'
content: Terrorists are positioned at Line of Control launch pads, actively seeking to infiltrate Kashmir before the onset of winter, a senior BSF officer confirmed. Security forces remain highly alert and fully prepared to thwart these attempts, which typically increase ahead of snowfall. Two infiltration bids have already been foiled this year due to tight security and modern surveillance.

title: Asia Cup: R Ashwin lambasts Harshit Rana's performance against Sri Lanka
content: Former India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin slammed pacer Harshit Rana's "amateurish" bowling after India's tense Super 4s clash against Sri Lanka in the Asia Cup 2025. Harshit conceded 54 runs, struggling with predictable deliveries, but dismissed centurion Pathum Nissanka in the final over, forcing a Super Over that India ultimately won.

title: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu challenges Microsoft: We offer better experience
content: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu publicly challenged Microsoft, claiming Zoho offers a broader and superior product suite, asserting it's the only company capable of competing. This follows IT minister Ashwini Vaishnaw's adoption of Zoho's Swadeshi platform, urging others to embrace indigenous products. Vembu thanked the minister, boosting his team's morale.

title: Hyderabad floods: Over 1,000 rescued after Musi River overflows
content: Heavy rains in Hyderabad caused the Musi River to overflow near Chaderghat Bridge after Himayat Sagar gates opened, leading to road closures, traffic, and flooding. Chief Minister Revanth Reddy directed officials to remain on high alert, monitor flood-prone areas, and relocate residents, with emergency teams on standby for continued rain forecasts.

title: Bengaluru: Class 9 girl withdraws sexual abuse claim against mom
content: A Bengaluru class nine student initially accused her mother of sexual harassment. She later told a juvenile court there was no misconduct. The girl stated she was angry with her mother for punishment. Police struggled to record her statement. The mother and sister claimed the girl was influenced by Western culture. This new version will be part of the chargesheet.

title: ‘Bored of home food’: Ahmedabad sisters beaten by drunk mom for ordering online food
content: Two girls approached the Abhayam helpline after their inebriated mother beat them for ordering food online, citing boredom with home meals. Their parents had divorced five years prior due to the mother's lifestyle. Counsellors placed the girls, who were home for exams, in their grandparents' custody to ensure their education continued, while also counselling the mother.

title: 'You said he was operating from India...': Pak min contradicts self on Imran Khan
content: Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif faced scrutiny over contradictory claims about Imran Khan's Twitter, first stating he operated it from jail, then struggling to explain previous allegations of Indian control, citing unproven intelligence. He also affirmed China as Pakistan's reliable, long-standing ally and primary arms supplier.

title: Trump's 100% drug tariffs: Indian generics spared but pose risks for pharma sector
content: US President Trump announced a 100% tariff on imported branded and patented pharmaceuticals starting October 2025, aiming to boost domestic manufacturing. Indian generic drug makers are largely unaffected initially, but concerns loom over potential tariff expansion to complex generics. Sun Pharma faces significant exposure due to its US branded portfolio.

title: 'If destroyed runways look ... ': India's sharp rebuttal to Shehbaz at UN
content: India strongly countered Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif's UN remarks, where he claimed Pakistan downed Indian jets and praised Trump for a ceasefire. India's UN representative, Petal Gahlot, refuted this, stating "Operation Sindoor" was an Indian action against terrorists in Pakistan and that Pakistan had pleaded for a ceasefire after threatening more attacks.

title: Record-breaking! Kuldeep Yadav creates history with new feat
content: Kuldeep Yadav etched his name in Asia Cup history, securing a record 13 wickets in six innings during the 2025 T20 edition with an impressive economy rate. His consistent spin and crucial breakthroughs proved instrumental for India, guiding them through tough matches. This landmark performance now bolsters India's confidence as they head into the final against Pakistan.

title: 'Miscreants will not be spared': CM Yogi's warning ahead of Dussehra
content: CM Yogi Adityanath has directed Uttar Pradesh authorities to take strict action against miscreants and ensure heightened security during the upcoming Dussehra celebrations. Police are instructed to identify troublemakers using video footage, especially after recent incidents, and maintain law and order, women's safety, and regulatory compliance. He also emphasized immediate arrests for rumour-mongers and vigilance against caste tensions.

title: Image of Jesus Christ replaced by Lord Krishna in Durga puja pandal
content: The image of Jesus Christ in a Vatican City-themed Durga Puja pandal in Ranchi was replaced with Lord Krishna's following objections from the Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP). The VHP alleged the original display hurt Hindu sentiments and encouraged conversion. Organizers stated the decision was made by committee members to promote religious harmony, not due to protests.

title: Happy Daughter's Day 2025: 51 Best wishes, quotes and messages
content: This article celebrates the unique and cherished bond between daughters and their parents, highlighting the profound love, support, and joy that define this relationship. It provides a collection of heartfelt wishes, inspiring quotes, and special messages to honor daughters on Daughter's Day, emphasizing their role as a blessing and the heart of the family.

title: Bangladesh’s mastermind once belonged to Pakistan – now he’s laughing at their struggles
content: During Pakistan's nervy Super Four match against Bangladesh, former captain Rashid Latif sparked social media chatter with a pointed tweet about Mushtaq Ahmed's dual coaching roles. Pakistan ultimately secured an 11-run victory, defending 135, thanks to Shaheen Afridi and Haris Rauf's bowling.

title: 'Slapped, uniform torn': Delhi traffic cop assaulted by group for stopping helmetless duo
content: A traffic police sub-inspector was assaulted by a group of men in north Delhi after stopping them for a helmet check. Four individuals have been arrested, with two confessing to inciting the crowd by falsely alleging communal remarks. The officer sustained injuries, and police are searching for other suspects involved in the attack.

title: Google celebrates its 27th birthday with a touch of nostalgia
content: Google marked its 27th birthday on September 27, 2025, with a Google Doodle. The company started as a startup in 1998, founded by Larry Page and Sergey Brin. It developed into a technology leader. Its services, including Search and Maps, became part of life. The birthday celebration highlighted its journey and future innovations, including AI.

title: HC clears return: Russian woman in Gokarna cave allowed to go home; travel docs issued
content: The Karnataka High Court has allowed the central government to issue travel documents for an overstaying Russian woman, Nina Kutina, and her two minor daughters to return to Russia. The family was found living in an isolated cave near Gokarna.

title: '285 Bitcoins worth Rs 150cr': ED files chargesheet against Raj Kundra in Crypto scam
content: The Enforcement Directorate has charged businessman Raj Kundra, accusing him of being the beneficial owner of 285 Bitcoins, worth Rs 150.47 crore, received from crypto-scam mastermind Amit Bhardwaj. Kundra allegedly concealed evidence, failed to surrender the Bitcoins, and conducted a below-market transaction with his wife to disguise criminal proceeds, despite a mining deal not materializing.

title: Heartwarming! Suryakumar Yadav consoles Dunith Wellalage after tragic loss - watch
content: India captain Suryakumar Yadav offered heartfelt support to Sri Lanka's Dunith Wellalage, who recently lost his father, during the Asia Cup Super 4s. Despite his personal tragedy, Wellalage played, while India secured a thrilling Super Over victory against Sri Lanka, setting up a final clash with archrival Pakistan.

title: 'Incendiary actions': Why is US revoking Colombian president’s visa? All you need to know
content: The US will revoke Colombian President Gustavo Petro's visa after his controversial remarks at a New York pro-Palestine rally. Petro urged US soldiers to disobey orders and accused Donald Trump of Gaza "genocide complicity." He also called for a massive military response to the conflict, escalating US-Colombia tensions. Washington deemed his actions "reckless and incendiary."

title: Kidney cancer cases to double by 2050: 5 warning signs you should not ignore
content: Kidney cancer cases are projected to double globally by 2050, primarily due to preventable factors like obesity, smoking, and lack of exercise, a new study reveals. Researchers from Fox Chase Cancer Center emphasize that over half of cases stem from modifiable lifestyle choices.  Early detection is crucial, as many dismiss warning signs. Prevention include lifestyle changes such as weight control, blood pressure, blood sugar management, and smoking cessation can significantly lower the risk, and prevent cancer.

title: Kirk’s past attacks on Taylor Swift resurface after his death
content: Following Charlie Kirk's death, his old derogatory post targeting Taylor Swift has resurfaced. In 2018, Kirk criticized Swift for endorsing a Democrat and questioning Marsha Blackburn's stance on women's issues. Swift had openly opposed Blackburn's views on LGBTQ+ rights and women's rights. The resurfaced post has drawn attention amid the controversy surrounding Kirk's assassination.

title: '18 accounts, 28 FD's': Court dismisses anticipatory bail plea of godman for fraud
content: A Delhi court denied anticipatory bail to Chaitanyananda Saraswati, alias Parthasarathy, who faces charges of cheating, forgery, and sexual harassment. The former institute director is accused of misappropriating funds, forging documents for two passports with differing identities, and fabricating records. Police froze Rs 8 crore as he remains at large, requiring custodial interrogation.

title: ‘Followed into bathroom, recorded’: Trump official assaulted at UNGA
content: A Trump administration official faced a physical assault at the United Nations. The incident happened during the UN General Assembly. A "deranged leftist" reportedly attacked the Department of Health and Human Services official. The assailant followed the official into a bathroom. The person was arrested and later released. The US Secret Service will investigate security lapses.

title: 'No degree of drama can conceal facts': India responds to Pak PM's remarks at UN
content: India strongly rebutted Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif’s UN General Assembly address, labeling his remarks as "absurd theatrics" and accusing Pakistan of glorifying terrorism. Indian diplomat Petal Gahlot highlighted Pakistan's history of sheltering terrorists and its role in the Pahalgam attack. Sharif, conversely, accused India of unprovoked aggression, targeting civilians, and falsely claimed shooting down Indian jets.

title: 'For economic security': Trump admin mulls chip-based tariffs on foreign electronics
content: The Trump administration is reportedly planning new tariffs on imported electronics, based on their chip content, to boost US manufacturing. This move could impose a 25% rate on chip value, potentially raising costs for American consumers and worsening inflation. Major chipmakers like TSMC and Samsung might face significant impact, as the policy aims to reshore critical production.

title: Indian study permits in Canada drop 50%; implications for education sector & economy
content: Canada has seen a 50% decline in Indian study permit approvals in 2025, with projections suggesting a 67.5% drop from 2023. The number of new student arrivals and total permit holders has also decreased sharply. According to ICEF Monitor, this trend stems from stricter immigration policies, economic pressures, and rising global competition. The downturn could lead to a $10.5 billion shortfall in economic contributions, severely affecting Canadian education institutions and provincial economies.

title: 'I told him ...': Suryakumar opens up on why Arshdeep Singh bowled Super Over
content: India secured a thrilling Super Over victory against Sri Lanka in their final Asia Cup Super Four match, with captain Suryakumar Yadav praising Sanju Samson, Tilak Varma, and Arshdeep Singh's decisive bowling. Despite Pathum Nissanka's century for Sri Lanka, India remained unbeaten, advancing to the final after a high-scoring contest that went down to the wire.

title: Protests over ‘I Love Muhammad’ posters turn violent in Bareilly; 50 detained
content: Bareilly witnessed violent protests after Friday prayers over 'I Love Muhammad' posters, as over 1,000 people pelted stones at police and vandalised vehicles. Police responded with lathi charge and tear gas, injuring ten cops. Fifty individuals, including IMC chief Maulana Tauqeer Raza Khan, were detained. The unrest, sparked by an FIR in Kanpur, led to similar demonstrations across other states.

title: High-speed crash in Gurgaon: Five killed as Thar flips after hitting divider
content: Five occupants, including three females, died when their black Thar crashed into a divider and overturned near Jharsa chowk in Gurgaon early Saturday morning. The driver reportedly lost control due to high speed while traveling from Delhi to Gurgaon. All victims were declared dead at a local hospital following the tragic accident.

title: 'Corrupt': Trump urges Microsoft to sack Lisa Monaco; calls her 'menace to US security'
content: US President Donald Trump publicly demanded Microsoft dismiss Lisa Monaco. He cited national security risks due to her past government roles. Monaco, a former Obama and Biden administration official, now leads Microsoft's global affairs. Trump linked his demand to legal cases against him. This action aligns with his pattern of targeting political adversaries and influencing corporate decisions.

title: Rajasthan horror: Newborn found with mouth glued, buried alive under stones in forest
content: Police in Bhilwara arrested an unmarried woman and her father for burying her 20-day-old newborn under stones with glue in his mouth to conceal an illegal birth. A shepherd discovered the infant, leading to a prompt police rescue and hospital admission.

title: Submit report on social and economic condition of liberated bonded labourers in a week: Shilpa Nag
content: Shilpa Nag pointed out that a few bonded labourers, who had been freed in Chamarajanagar and Gundlupet taluks, had died while some others had still not been not been issued identity cards and release certificates

title: V.D. Satheesan says UDF not perturbed by NSS support for LDF’s Sabarimala policy
content: Satheesan dismissed the question of whether the UDF would “mend fences” with NSS, saying the question was irrelevant since the UDF had no fall out with the NSS

title: Kaziranga records 283 species of native insects, spiders
content: Assam forest officials said the first such survey highlights the need to focus on insect conservation, especially as climate change threatens to accelerate species loss

title: Mumbai-Ahmedabad section of India’s bullet train project will open by 2029: Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw in Surat
content: After becoming operational, the bullet train will cover the distance between Mumbai and Ahmedabad in just two hours and seven minutes, Ashwini Vaishnaw said

title: Three Indian doctors awarded with Gates Foundation’s Goalkeepers Champions Award
content: Dr. Abhay and Dr. Rani Bang’s initiative focussed on the effect of community engagement and simple, low-cost interventions on creating lasting health impact

title: Bengaluru Metro commuters hit by WhatsApp ticketing glitch
content: For many, the WhatsApp chatbot has been the preferred way to book tickets as it avoids waiting at long queues and does not require daily use of a metro card.

title: Amid protests Nair Service Society General Secretary stands by LDF on Sabarimala
content: Another banner demanding G. Sukumaran Nair’s resignation has appeared near a Karayogam office of the NSS near Poonjar

title: Police arrest mother for burning child with hot ladle in Kerala’s Alappuzha
content: According to the police, the mother committed the act after becoming enraged when the child soiled his trousers

title: Govt mistaken if it feels arresting Wangchuk will restore peace in Ladakh: UT Congress
content: Wangchuk was detained under the National Security Act on Friday (September 26, 2025) and was lodged in Jodhpur jail in Rajasthan

title: Watch: Ladakh’s statehood protests: The full story
content: Ladakh’s protest began as a hunger strike demanding statehood, inclusion under the Sixth Schedule, local jobs, and land protection but September 24, violence erupted in Leh.

title: Fugitive AAP leader Harmeet Singh Pathanmajra releases video, targets party MLAs for not supporting him
content: The Punjab MLA has been on the run since September 2. He escaped police custody when the Punjab Police went to Haryana's Karnal to arrest him in the case

title: NIA chargesheets key accused in 2024 Jharkhand Naxal attack on security forces
content: “Abhijeet Koda of Jamui district in Bihar has been named in the charge sheet filed on September 26, before the NIA special court, Ranchi, Jharkhand,” officials said

title: 11-year-old moves Supreme Court against entrance tests in CM Shri schools
content: The writ petition, filed under Article 32 of the Constitution, contends that the admission test violates Article 21-A of the Constitution, which guarantees the right to free and compulsory education and Section 13 of the Right of Children to Free and Compulsory Education Act, 2009 (RTE Act).

title: In pictures | South India witnesses time-honoured Navaratri traditions
content: Here are images from Southern India where the states are celebrating the Navaratri season. The festive cheer is spread around with display of dolls, temple processions and music.

title: Oil India discovers natural gas in Andaman shallow offshore block
content: ONGC had, in March this year, begun drilling of an ultra-deepwater well ANE-E in the Andaman offshore, but the firm has not indicated the results of the drilling

title: PM Modi inaugurates BSNL’s 'swadeshi' 4G network from Odisha
content: The Prime Minister also unveiled India’s 100% 4G saturation network through digital Bharat Nidhi, where 29,000 to 30,000 villages are connected in a mission-mode project

title: Hyderabad rains: Family stranded in Chaderghat; officials monitoring situation
content: Local residents alleged that they had not received any alert about the rising water levels, though authorities claim that they began rescue and rehabilitation efforts by Friday evening

title: At least five killed, one injured after speeding Thar collides with divider on Delhi-Gurugram Expressway
content: Five people, including three women and two men, died on the spot, while one man was critically injured and admitted to a private hospital

title: Curfew remains in force in Leh, patrolling intensified amid uneasy calm after Sonam Wangchuk’s arrest
content: Lt. Governor Kavinder Gupta is shortly chairing a high-level security review meeting at Raj Bhavan, and any decision to relax curfew will be taken accordingly

title: Waqf Board not to be reconstituted until Supreme Court pronounces final verdict: T.N. Minister
content: Mr. Nasar assured that the Waqf Board would not be reconstituted in Tamil Nadu as per the amended Act, which he claimed was hastily implemented by the Centre, until the Supreme Court pronounces its final verdict.

title: Congress left no opportunity to loot people, even taxed those in low-income group, alleges PM
content: This is the PM's sixth visit to the state in 15 months since the BJP came to power in Odisha in June 2024

title: ‘Babbar Khalsa International terrorist Pindi extradited from Abu Dhabi to India,’ says Punjab DGP
content: Pindi is a close aide of foreign-based terrorists Harwinder Singh alias Rinda and Happy Passia and is involved in multiple heinous crimes

title: Traffic restrictions for Bathukamma festival at Hyderabad’s Tank Bund on September 27; congestion likely at major junctions
content: Congestion is likely at major junctions including Khairatabad, Iqbal Minar, Liberty, Ravindra Bharati, Necklace Rotary, Tank Bund, Ranigunj and Nallagutta

title: Eknath Shinde announces comprehensive development plan for Maharashtra’s Thane district
content: Eknath Shinde said MMRDA will appoint an expert committee to study traffic congestion across the Mumbai Metropolitan Region and propose a permanent solution

title: ‘Chances of infiltration high along LoC before snowfall, security on high alert’: BSF Kashmir IG
content: IG Ashok Yadav said there is a presence of terrorists on the launch pads across the LoC opposite the AOR (area of responsibility) in the Bandipora and Kupwara sectors.

title: Hagrama Mohilary’s Bodoland People’s Front registers landslide victory in Bodoland Territorial Council elections
content: The Bodoland People's Front (BPF) improved its tally from the 17 seats it had won last time and secured an absolute majority

title: NIA attaches immovable properties of terror operative in Kashmir
content: On the orders of the NIA special court in Jammu, the agency attached immovable properties of Tariq Ahmad Mir, a chargesheeted accused who was arrested in April in a terror-related case.

title: Ahead of PM Modi's visit, heavy rainfall continues in Odisha as depression crosses coastal areas
content: Initially, the place for the PM's public meeting was fixed at Berhampur in Ganjam district in the southern part of the State, but it was later changed to Jharsuguda due to a forecast of heavy rain in that region

title: IMD predicts heavy showers in Mumbai, suburbs; orange alert issued
content: The traffic on the city roads is normal, while the local train services are operating with some delays

title: Rahul Gandhi embarks on four-nation South America visit
content: According to the Congress, Mr. Gandhi will visit Brazil and Colombia, where he is expected to interact with university students

title: Two militants involved in Sept. 19 ambush on Assam Rifles convoy in Manipur arrested
content: One of the two militants was picked up from Assam's Guwahati, but the police did not disclose the location where the other was arrested

title: The Jail That Houses Sonam Wangchuk And An Activist's Hunger Strike Threat
content: Ladakh statehood activist Sonam Wangchuk, who was arrested under the National Security Act (NSA), was shifted to Jodhpur jail in Rajasthan.

title: How DNA Linked Dead Man To 1991 Killings Of 4 Girls At Texas Yogurt Shop
content: Police named a dead man as a new suspect in the 1991 unsolved killings of four teenage girls at an Austin yogurt shop, saying DNA evidence led to a "significant breakthrough" in the brutal crime that has haunted Texas' capital.

title: Railways Flooded With Over 61 Lakh Passenger Complaints In 2 Years, Security Tops List
content: Complaints related to safety in trains shot up by a staggering 64%, from 4.57 lakh in 2023-24 to over 7.50 lakh in 2024-25.

title: "Shaken Public's Trust": Ex-BJP MP Demands Probe Into Ladakh Violence
content: A top BJP leader from Ladakh has questioned the Government's handling of the situation in Ladakh and the killing of four protesters in security forces' firing on Wednesday.

title: India Launches 'Swadeshi' 4G Network, Joins China, Denmark, Sweden, South Korea
content: In a major boost to tele-communication infrastructure, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday inaugurated BSNL's 'Swadeshi' 4G stack, marking India's entry into a coveted league of nations that manufacture telecom equipment.

title: Raj Kundra Has 285 Bitcoins Worth Rs 150 Crore: Probe Agency On Crypto 'Scam'
content: The Enforcement Directorate has filed a chargesheet against businessman Raj Kundra in a bitcoin 'scam' saying he was a beneficial owner and not just a 'mediator' in the transactions as claimed by him.

title: Meitei, Thadou Leaders Ask Governor To Disqualify Manipur BJP MLA Paolienlal Haokip Over Citizenship
content: BJP MLA Paolienlal Haokip, one of the fiercest critics of former Manipur chief minister N Biren Singh and a key political figure in the demand for a separate administration for the Kuki tribes, has termed the move a bid to silence him.

title: 5-Year-Old Boy Beheaded In Front Of Mother In Madhya Pradesh, Killer Lynched
content: A five-year-old boy, Vikas, was brutally murdered inside his home in Madhya Pradesh by a man believed to be mentally unstable on Friday.

title: Key Accused In NEET Aspirant's Murder In UP Killed In Encounter
content: The accused in the murder of NEET candidate Deepak Gupta from Gorakhpur was killed in a police encounter here, police said on Saturday.

title: Who Is Petal Gahlot, Indian Diplomat Who Gave Sharp Response To Pakistan PM At UN
content: Indian diplomat Petal Gahlot delivered a sharp response to Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif at the UN.

title: US To Revoke Colombian President's Visa Over 'Reckless, Incendiary Actions'
content: President Petro shared video of himself speaking  to a large crowd through a megaphone, with his translator then relaying his comments calling on "nations of the world" to contribute soldiers for an army "larger than that of the US."

title: "I Did My Duty": US Man Admits To Killing, Burying His Parents On TV
content: A man admitted during a television interview to killing his parents and burying them in the backyard of their upstate New York home eight years ago, then was arrested as he left the studio.

title: Big Boost For Shashi Tharoor Likely If Centre Makes This Parliament Move
content: The government is considering the opposition's suggestion to hike the tenure of parliamentary standing committees to ensure that the bills and policy matters are scrutinised more thoroughly and in depth, said sources.

title: Rahul Gandhi Embarks On 4-Nation South America Visit
content: Leader of the Opposition in the Lok Sabha, Rahul Gandhi, has embarked on a visit to four South American countries, where he is expected to interact with political leaders, students, and businessmen.

title: US Deploys Warships In Caribbean, Venezuela Fears Invasion
content: Venezuela, on high alert over a US military deployment off its coast that has stirred invasion fears, will hold disaster preparedness drills on Saturday as President Nicolas Maduro mulls invoking emergency powers.

title: Trump Mulls Tariffs On Foreign Electronics Based On Number Of Chips: Reports
content: The Trump administration is considering imposing tariffs on foreign electronic devices based on the number of chips in each device, according to three people familiar with the matter, as it seeks to drive companies to shift their manufacturing to US.

title: Wall Street To Academia, Who Is In Trump's Line Of Fire
content: US President Donald Trump has escalated his criticism and actions against executives, corporations and institutions. His unprecedented actions - from novel export deals to frozen university grants - have upended the status quo between the government,

title: 5 Dead As Speeding Thar Loses Control, Hits Divider On Gurugram Highway
content: Five people died and one was left severely injured after a speeding Thar they were in lost control and crashed into a divider on the National Highway in Gurugram on Saturday morning.

title: "Will I Kiss Her?" Row Deepens After Madhya Pradesh Minister's Remark On Rahul-Priyanka Gandhi Bond
content: The controversy over Madhya Pradesh Minister Kailash Vijayvargiya's remarks targeting Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi's bond with his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has now deepened, with his cabinet colleague Vijay Shah openly backing him.

title: Google Turns 27: Birthday Doodle Brings Back Its "First-Ever" 1998 Logo
content: Google is marking its 27th birthday with a special throwback on its homepage, offering a glimpse of where it all began.

title: Historic! Sanju Samson breaks Dhoni’s record for most T20I sixes
content: Sanju Samson has now become India's leading T20I wicketkeeper in terms of sixes, surpassing MS Dhoni's record with 55 maximums. Despite adapting to different batting positions, he showcased his destructive power, contributing a vital 39 runs against Sri Lanka. His consistent ability to clear boundaries and adaptability make him a crucial asset for India's upcoming Asia Cup final.

title: Madras High Court upholds Tamil Nadu government’s new minibus scheme
content: Justice N. Mala says, the scheme warrants judicial affirmation since it was intended at ensuring last-mile connectivity by reaching areas that remain unserved even after 78 years of Independence

title: Pakistani military pleaded for cessation of fighting during Operation Sindoor: India exercises Right of Reply at UNGA
content: Ms. Gahlot said in the UNGA hall that “we saw many pictures of terrorists slain in Bahawalpur and Muridke terror complexes by Indian forces during Operation Sindoor”

title: High Court seeks instructions on NDPS special courts
content: The court was hearing a batch of petitions, including by Ernakulam native Sumi Joseph, the mother of two school-going children, seeking effective measures by the State government to curb the use of narcotic.

title: GCDA to hand over Kaloor stadium to SKF for preparations ahead of Argentina’s match
content: SKF will carry out the necessary infrastructure upgrades based on a detailed plan. Traders operating in the shops surrounding the stadium will need to be temporarily relocated or shut down, says GCDA

title: Rains LIVE: Musi river floods parts of Hyderabad; Kulsumpura, Chaderghat and Moosarambagh roads closed
content: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecast “heavy rain and thunderstorms with lightning” in parts of Andhra Pradesh until October 2

title: Engaged with Trump administration, other stakeholders: India on H-1B visa fee hike
content: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) said the mobility of skilled talent has contributed enormously to innovation, economic growth and wealth creation in both the U.S. and India

title: JJP criticises Haryana govt. for income limit in new scheme for women
content: The BJP during the election had promised ₹2,100 monthly financial assistance under the scheme to all women, says party’s youth wing State president Digvijay Chautala

title: J&K L-G Manoj Sinha announces re-opening of 12 tourist spots closed after Pahalgam attack
content: An official said out of 12 tourist spots thrown open, five are in the Jammu division and seven in the Kashmir division.

title: Every penny of Rangla Punjab to be used for flood-hit people: CM Mann
content: CM Mann noted that contributions through Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) could not be made to the Chief Minister's Relief Fund, and even Members of Parliament can donate a maximum of 20 lakh to it.

title: Giving warriors a fighting chance: Where personnel injured in line of duty are trained to become para-athletes and IT professionals
content: In 2020, the National Centre for Divyang Empowerment was established as an exclusive facility for training CAPF personnel who suffer injuries and become physically challenged in the line of duty. In five years, the centre has trained 219 ‘Divyang warriors’, producing medal-winning para-athletes and IT professionals. Vijaita Singh and Naveen Kumar report on how the facilities on campus give the injured a new lease of life

title: Two Kerala students allege assault by Delhi police personnel
content: Denying allegations of theft, they say police officers brutally assaulted them, forced them to speak in Hindi and ridiculed them for wearing lungi; MP John Brittas seeks impartial probe into ‘custodial brutality’

title: DRDO wins businessline’s Changemaker of the Year Award for its strategic technology
content: The Azim Premji Foundation won the Iconic Changemaker Award for its pioneering and extensive work in education and healthcare

title: CBI coordinates return of UAPA accused from UAE
content: Parminder Singh was wanted by the Punjab police in a case of alleged extortion, raising funds for terrorist acts, attempt to murder and criminal intimidation

title: Sonam Wangchuk detained under NSA & shifted to Jodhpur: Ladakh administration
content: Time and again, it has been observed that Wangchuk has been indulging in activities prejudicial to the security of the state and detrimental to maintenance of peace and public order and services essential to the community, the Directorate of Information & Public Relations (DIPR), Ladakh said in a statement here.

title: Punjab Ministers blame Centre of ‘step-motherly’ attitude towards Punjab; Congress demands probe on floods
content: What’s even more troubling is the Prime Minister’s announcement of a paltry ₹1600 crore relief package, of which not a single rupee has been disbursed to Punjab to date, says Punjab Finance Minister Harpal Singh Cheema

title: New farming technology holds potential to stop desertification
content: The researchers have essentially carried out modification of desert sand into soil using polymers for reaping its full agricultural potential

title: Stalin inaugurates civic amenities set up at cost of ₹41.83 crore
content: The projects include upgraded sports facilities at Bharathidasan Stadium in Shenoy Nagar and amenities at parks in Koyambedu and Ramapuram

title: CEO of Hong Kong firm alleges ₹15-crore cargo fraud
content: B. Subramanyan says the Container Freight Station in Vallur near Kattupalli Port unlawfully released his company goods to the importers without the original bills of lading or valid Delivery Orders; he alleges that his subsequent inquiries had revealed a larger conspiracy involving 21 individuals, including representatives of the import firms, shipping companies, and officials of the freight station

title: R. Venkataramani re-appointed as Attorney General
content: The President is pleased to re-appoint Shri R Venkataramani, Senior Advocate, as Attorney General for India for a further period of two years with effect from 01.10.2025, a notification read.

title: Renovation of open-air auditorium begins at Cusat
content: The structural changes will be implemented as per the recommendations made by a four-member technical committee appointed by the Syndicate after the tragic stampede that occurred on November 25, 2023

title: Police said Sonam Wangchuk was being taken to Jodhpur, says wife
content: Gitanjali Angmo said she was yet to receive a copy of the formal detention order. “We will prepare the legal response once we get a copy of the order,” she said. Ladakh Buddhist Association president Cherring Dorjay Lakruk pledges legal support for Sonam Wangchuk.

title: NISAR satellite sends first radar images of Earth’s surface
content: The images display details with which NISAR scans Earth to provide unique, actionable information to decision-makers in a diverse range of areas

title: BPF leads in Assam’s Bodoland council polls
content: The party was leading in 21 of the autonomous council’s 40 seats, more than 12 hours after the counting of votes began at 8 a.m. on Friday. The UPPL and ally-turned-rival BJP are set to win almost as many seats as in the 2020 polls.

title: Congress slams detention of Ladakh activist Sonam Wangchuk, demands judicial probe into violence that left four youth dead
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh says detention was meant to divert attention from BJP’s failure to ensure security, Sixth Schedule status in Ladakh; Congress Ladakh chief slams “police firing” against protestors

title: Zubeen Garg death: Women’s ODI World Cup opening ceremony toned down
content: BCCI is consciously moving marquee cricket matches out of tier 1 cities to attract more girls to cricket, Secretary Devajit Saikia says

title: Science Ministry survey on R&D in India gets weak response from private sector
content: The latest edition of the survey was launched in December 2024 with firms given time until September 30, 2025 to submit responses; the deadline may be extended now

title: AAP attacks BJP over Sonam Wangchuk’s detention
content: Drawing parallels to Ravana, Hitler, and Mussolini, AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal responds to activist’s detention by warning of the downfall of “those who practice dictatorship and arrogance”

title: Bareilly tense as police personnel and protesters clash over poster row
content: The protest was against the police FIR against people who carried ‘I Love Muhammed’ posters at a Kanpur procession on September 4

title: Tile-by-tile restoration brings back the lost splendour of Paigah Tombs in Hyderabad
content: After decades of neglect, destruction, and encroachment, the tombs are now being restored by the State government and the Aga Khan Trust for Culture, with funding from the U.S. State Department’s Ambassadors Fund for Cultural Preservation

title: QuantM: A game-changer for milk safety and farmer livelihoods
content: What makes the innovation even more powerful is its integration with NIAB’s rapid antimicrobial sensitivity kit, as a result the two tests can confirm both the presence of mastitis and the most effective treatment within two hours — a process that typically takes two to three days in conventional labs

title: Recall Char Dham project judgment: Murli Manohar Joshi, environmentalists to Supreme Court
content: Environmentalists have argued that cutting hill slopes and the resulting debris are damaging to the eco-system and worsen the impact of landslides and torrential rains as well as cause massive roadblocks and pile-up on these mountain roads.

title: India says NATO chief’s remarks on Modi-Putin talks ‘entirely baseless’
content: Speculative or careless remarks that misrepresent the Prime Minister’s engagements are unacceptable, says MEA Spokesperson

title: Thadou, Meitei leaders seek disqualification of BJP MLA Paolienlal Haokip

title: Vellore Corporation to focus on UGD work, community dogs sterilization, road re-lay: Mayor
content: Most of the councillors highlighted the need to conduct monthly council meetings as against the existing practice of once in three or four months as such an arrangement will allow them to air public grievances regularly.

title: Union Minister Amit Shah visits poll-bound Bihar for two days

title: Calcutta HC directs repatriation of six West Bengal residents pushed into Bangladesh
content: “Not following such procedure and acting in hot haste to deport them is a clear violation which renders the deportation order bad in law and liable to be set aside,” the Bench noted.

title: Veritas Sainik School in Tirupati added for spot counselling
content: It is aimed at providing candidates a wider choice of schools, says a circular from the Sainik Schools Society

title: Lynx's Reeve blasts refs after Collier hurt in loss
content: Ejected late in Game 3, Lynx coach Cheryl Reeve was critical of the officials Friday night, saying it was "malpractice" to have them work a semifinal playoff game.

title: Bradley not worried about Scheffler, defends picks
content: U.S. captain Keegan Bradley defended his pairings picks and said he's not worried about Scottie Scheffler, who was winless in two matches Friday and will be in action again Saturday morning.

title: Rafaela's walk-off triple sends Red Sox to playoffs
content: Ceddanne Rafaela tripled to drive in the game-ending run in the ninth inning Friday night, giving the Red Sox a 4-3 victory over the Tigers and clinching Boston's first postseason berth since 2021.

title: Reds tie Mets for NL's 3rd and final wild-card spot
content: The Reds have put themselves in position to earn their first playoff berth since the pandemic-shortened 2020 season while keeping the free-spending Mets out of the postseason.

title: Virginia stuns No. 8 FSU in 2OT as fans storm field
content: Virginia held on for a 46-38 double-overtime win over No. 8 Florida State on Friday night, leading to a chaotic postgame scene in which fans rushed the field.

title: 49ers QB Purdy good to start after sitting out 2
content: After missing the past two games with a toe injury, 49ers quarterback Brock Purdy is healthy and will start against the Jaguars.

title: NFL HQ building shooter diagnosed with CTE
content: Shane Tamura, who killed four people and then himself in a July shooting at the NFL HQ building, was posthumously diagnosed with chronic traumatic encephalopathy, according to a statement from the New York City Officer of the Chief Medical Examiner.
